c) Abrasion, Debonding, Delamination, Nicks, Dents, Gouges, Scratches

Questions.QuestionString: 41. Which type of damage is a skin perforated damage (with damage of fibres)? (Level 2)
Answers: a) Abrasion, Delamination, Scratches, Dents, Gouges
b) Holes, Lightning strike, Impact by foreign object (FOD)
c) Abrasion, Debonding, Delamination, Nicks, Dents, Gouges, Scratches

Questions.QuestionString: 42. Which of the following statements is correct about Scratch damage? (Level 1)
Answers:
a) Scratch is damage to a surface caused by scuffing, rubbing or scraping of the component.
Fibres are not damaged and mechanical performance is not affected.

b) Scratch is when a separation of materials, e.g. stringer to skin, occurs due to an adhesive
failure

c) Scratch is the result of contact with a sharp object and only surface fibres are affected and the
edges are sharp

Questions.QuestionString: 43. Which of the following statements is correct about Abrasion damage? (Level 1)
Answers:
a) Abrasion is damage to a surface caused by scuffing, rubbing or scraping of the component.
Fibres are not damaged and mechanical performance is not affected.

b) Abrasion is when a separation of materials, e.g. stringer to skin, occurs due to an adhesive
failure

c) Abrasion is the result of contact with a sharp object and only surface fibres are affected and the
edges are sharp

Questions.QuestionString: 44. Which of the following statements is correct about Debonding damage? (Level 2)
Answers:
a) Debonding is damage to a surface caused by scuffing, rubbing or scraping of the component.
Fibres are not damaged and mechanical performance is not affected.

b) Debonding is when a separation of materials, e.g. stringer to skin, occurs due to an adhesive
failure

c) Debonding is the result of contact with a sharp object and only surface fibres are affected and
the edges are sharp

Questions.QuestionString: 45. Which of the following statements is correct about Lightning Strike damage? (Level 1)
Answers:
a) The effect of a lightning strike depends on the material will not be the same. For non
conductive materials like Glass- and Aramid Fibre a large part of the component, if not
completely protected, may be blown out because both skins are affected and the core generally
vapourised due to the extreme heat

b) Lightning strike is when a separation of materials, e.g. stringer to skin, occurs due to an
adhesive failure

c) Lightning strike is when the separation of plies occurs in a multi-laminate material. This can be
caused by the material being hit (impact delamination), or when there is a resin failure for any
other reason.

Questions.QuestionString: 46. Which of the following statements is correct about Delamination damage? (Level 2)
Answers:
a) Delamination is a deformity caused by extraneous forces, which are applied to the structure.
This can be an impact (FOD) for example.

b) Delamination is when a separation of materials, e.g. stringer to skin, occurs due to an adhesive
failure

c) Delamination is when the separation of plies occurs in a multi-laminate material. This can be
caused by the material being hit (impact delamination), or when there is a resin failure for any
other reason.

Questions.QuestionString: 47. Which of the following statements is correct about Dent damage? (Level 1)
Answers:
a) A dent is a deformity caused by extraneous forces, which are applied to the structure. This can
be an impact (FOD) for example.
b) A dent is when a separation of materials, e.g. stringer to skin, occurs due to an adhesive failure

c) A dent is when the separation of plies occurs in a multi-laminate material. This can be caused
by the material being hit (impact delamination), or when there is a resin failure for any other
reason.

Questions.QuestionString: 48. Which of the following statements is correct about Erosion damage? (Level 1)
Answers:
a) Erosion is the result of contact with a sharp object and only surface fibres are affected and the
edges are sharp.

b) Erosion could affect all the leading edge surfaces, especially when the initial surface protection
system has been damaged. Erosion, when undetected or unrepaired, may generate composite
deterioration.

c) Erosion principally affects the resin and is generally due to accidental contact with aggressive
chemical liquids or products (e.g. hydraulic fluid).

Questions.QuestionString:
49. Which of the following statements is correct about Chemical Degradation damage?
(Level 2)
Answers:
a) Chemical degradation is the result of contact with a sharp object, only surface fibres are
affected and the edges are sharp.

b) Chemical degradation could affect all the leading edge surfaces. Chemical degradation, when
undetected or unrepaired, may generate composite deterioration.

c) Chemical degradation principally affects the resin and is generally due to accidental contact
with aggressive chemical liquids or products (e.g. hydraulic fluid).

Questions.QuestionString:
50. What testing methods can detect the presence of debonding and delamination damages?
(Level 2)
Answers: a) Tap Testing, Visual or optical inspection

Questions.QuestionString: 51. Which of the following statements is correct about Tap testing? (Level 1)
Answers:
a) Tap testing is only capable of finding flaws that are evident on the visible surface. Internal
flaws in composites (such as delamination, disbonding and matrix crazing) are not detectable. In
addition, tight surface cracks and edge delamination may not be detectable.

b) Tap testing is extremely sensitive in measuring small surface defects. The part to be inspected
is stressed by the application of heat, a static load or vibration to bring out the effect of the flaw
on the surface displacement

c) Tap testing is widely used for the quick evaluation of any accessible aircraft surfaces to detect
presence of debonding or entrapped water.

Questions.QuestionString: 52. Which of the following statements is correct about Radiography testing? (Level 2)
Answers: a) Radiography is only capable of finding flaws that are evident on the visible surface.

b) The part to be inspected by radiography is stressed by the application of heat, a static load or
vibration to bring out the effect of the flaw on the surface displacement.
c) Radiography is a NDT technique that uses X-rays or gamma rays.

Questions.QuestionString: 53. Which of the following statements is correct about Ultrasonics testing? (Level 2)
Answers:
a) Ultrasonic waves travel through solids and liquids at relatively high speeds, but are rapidly
attenuated in gasses. The density and the elasticity of the medium may affect the wave speed.

b) The part to be inspected by ultrasonics is stressed by the application of heat, a static load or
vibration to bring out the effect of the flaw on the surface displacement.
c) Ultrasonics is a NDT technique that uses X-rays or gamma rays.

Questions.QuestionString: 54. What are the typical of repairs on Composite parts? (Level 1)
Answers: a) Injection repair, repair of edges.
b) Repair of coverings and honeycombs
c) Injection repair, repair of edges and repair of coverings, honeycombs

Questions.QuestionString:
55. Which of the following statements is correct about Repair through Injection of Resin?
(Level 1)
Answers:
a) Repair through Injection of Resin is recommended for small damages of the honeycomb
material. The area is filled with thickened resin/hardener alloy and in the next step made plane.
However, the repaired area has lost nearly the half of its original strength.

b) The repair through injection of resin is an approved repair for delamination or dissolving
adhesives. If the damaged is caused by contamination or water absorption, this type of repair is
not recommended.

c) Repair through Injection of Resin is typical for sandwich structures. It is easy to accomplish
especially if the damaged parts are very small. Today two different repairs of sandwich parts can
be accomplished:
_ Repair of the covering, if only one side of the covering and/or parts of the combs are damaged.
_ Repair of the covering, if both covering parts and the combs are damaged

Questions.QuestionString: 56. Which of the following statements is correct about Filling Repair? (Level 1)
Answers:
a) Filling Repair Resin is recommended for small damages of the honeycomb material. The area
is filled with thickened resin/hardener alloy and in the next step made plane. However, the
repaired area has lost nearly the half of its original strength.

b) Filling Repair is an approved repair for delamination or dissolving adhesives. If the damage is
caused by contamination or water absorption, this type of repair is not recommended.

c) Filling Repair is typical for sandwich structures. It is easy to accomplish especially if the
damaged parts are very small. Today two different repairs of sandwich parts can be
accomplished:
_ Repair of the covering, if only one side of the covering and/or parts of the combs are damaged.
_ Repair of the covering, if both covering parts and the combs are damaged

Questions.QuestionString: 62. What are the effects of the Perforated Parting Film? (Level 1)
Answers:
a) To prevent the bagging materials sticking to the repair surface. The film is perforated with
small holes to allow air and gases to escape from the repair piles. Some resin will escape through
the holes so, for repair, it is best to choose a film with pin-pricks to reduce the resin loss.
Perforated parting film will produce a shiny, resin-rich surface on the repair.

b) To help even-out the temperature over the entire repair, help even-out the pressure over the
whole repair and improve the flatness of the surface of the repair.
c) To allow the air and gases to escape easily

Perforated parting film will produce a shiny, resin-rich surface on the repair.

b) To help even-out the temperature over the entire repair, help even-out the pressure over the
whole repair and improve the flatness of the surface of the repair.
c) To allow the air and gases to escape easily

Questions.QuestionString: 6. What is definition of thermocouple correct? (Level 2)
Answers:
a) The thermocouple consists of two different metal alloys soldered or welded together in which a
minimal electrical potential is created when the wiring contact is heated which is proportional to
the temperature

b) The thermocouple consists of two different metal alloys soldered or welded together in which a
minimal electrical potential is created when the wiring contact is heated which is inversely
proportional to the temperature

c) The thermocouple consists of two different metal alloys soldered or welded together in which a
minimal electrical potential is created when the wiring contact is heated which is proportional to
the humidity
